Posts.Content: Lovemysons wrote: Today is 4 days post op. Still in ICU. Cath out and I peed this am!! Yay me - up sitting in chair for a little while. Hopefully I'm able to continue to go on my own and don't need recathed like before. Surgery didn't go as planned. Left side is tissue recon (diep flap) and right side is expander/implant recon. They worked with what they could - left side was up and running when right side failed so they decided after speaking to my husband they would leave left as it is and do implants on right. Haven't gotten a good look yet - not sure if I'm ready to either.  Dx 2/19/2014, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 0/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 3/25/2014 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Targeted Therapy 3/25/2014 Perjeta (pertuzumab) Chemotherapy 3/25/2014 Taxotere (docetaxel) Chemotherapy 5/7/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin) Surgery 9/10/2014 Lymph node removal: Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): DIEP flap, Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap, Tissue expander placement Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Lovemysons wrote: Made a trip to the ER yesterday. Had lower back pain that was intermitent and chest pressure. Xray, CAT scan and blood were all good. Probably reaction to shot. Most importantly - no blood clots related to port. Thank God!!!  Praying this doesn't happen with every treatment.  Dx 2/19/2014, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 0/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 3/25/2014 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Targeted Therapy 3/25/2014 Perjeta (pertuzumab) Chemotherapy 3/25/2014 Taxotere (docetaxel) Chemotherapy 5/7/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin) Surgery 9/10/2014 Lymph node removal: Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): DIEP flap, Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap, Tissue expander placement Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: ER Lovemysons Moderators

Posts.Content: Lovemysons wrote: I found the lump about a month ago, went to my GYN last week and had a mammo/ultrasound the next day.  What they saw was suspicious so they scheduled an ultrasound guided biopsy which was done on Monday, 2/17.  I’m not one of the 80% to come back B9.  Found out yesterday, it was positive and I have IDC, it's hormone receptor + and HER2+.  Don't know stage or grade yet.  The director of radiology is supposed to be calling me today.  My GYN’s office already called me this morning to schedule me with a BS but I'm opting to go to a different hospital so they are going to contact someone there to get me scheduled.  I’m hoping I’m not hurting myself more by opting for a different hospital instead of going with where I had the biopsy done.  I’m a nervous wreck.  I have two young boys (12 and 8), a great DH and family.  I'm about 3 months shy of 40.  My paternal gm had breast cancer but she was older when she was dx.  Hoping to learn and gain support from everyone.  Dx 2/19/2014, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 0/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 3/25/2014 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Targeted Therapy 3/25/2014 Perjeta (pertuzumab) Chemotherapy 3/25/2014 Taxotere (docetaxel) Chemotherapy 5/7/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin) Surgery 9/10/2014 Lymph node removal: Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): DIEP flap, Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap, Tissue expander placement Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2014 07:30PM Lovemysons wrote: Mine had particles in it when I left a sample at the hospital yesterday - not red though.  Hope it's nothing.  Keep us posted.
Posts.Title: Particles in urine? Allydp Allydp

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2014 10:53AM Lovemysons wrote: Radiologist called yesterday and the left breast area is benign but the right axillary lymph has a tumor.  They moved up my oncology appt to Tuesday, March 4.  They are thinking I will need chemo prior to surgery now that there is node involvement.  Praying the scan & MRI show no other cancer.
Posts.Title: Still waiting... Lovemysons kcat2013

Posts.Content: Lovemysons wrote: Not what I expected from the appointments yesterday. Biopsed area on left breast and axillary lymph node under right arm. MRI showed the mass in my right breast to be larger than the mammo showed. Not a chance at lumpectomy unless I do chemo to shrink it first. More tests ordered - PET/CT scan next week and brain MRI on the 13th. Also doing the genetic testing.  Can't get an appt with the oncologist till the 25th. Can't decide on treatment plan until I have all test results...waiting again. Dx 2/19/2014, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 0/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Targeted Therapy 3/25/2014 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Targeted Therapy 3/25/2014 Perjeta (pertuzumab) Chemotherapy 3/25/2014 Taxotere (docetaxel) Chemotherapy 5/7/2014 Carboplatin (Paraplatin) Surgery 9/10/2014 Lymph node removal: Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): DIEP flap, Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap, Tissue expander placement Log in to post a reply
